decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing the combo of Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game by manipulating the library and winning instantly when these two cards are on the battlefield. The deck includes cards like Dig Through Time, Thoughtseize, and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries to help dig through the library, control the board, and protect the combo pieces. The key strategy is to set up the combo as quickly and efficiently as possible while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free. It includes a variety of planeswalkers like Teferi, Gideon, Jace, and Chandra for board control and card advantage. The deck also utilizes enchantments like Oath of Chandra, Elspeth Conquers Death, and Detention Sphere to deal with threats on the board. Alongside board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Deafening Clarion, as well as card draw spells like Omen of the Sea and Drawn from Dreams, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing small creatures that provide incremental value when they die, such as Priest of Forgotten Gods, Zulaport Cutthroat, and Cruel Celebrant. By sacrificing these creatures and utilizing cards like Rally the Ancestors and Return to the Ranks, the deck aims to drain the opponent's life total quickly and efficiently. The deck also includes Fiend Artisan to search for key creatures and Keening Apparition to deal with problematic enchantments. The main goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and drain effects to secure a quick victory.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with quick and efficient damage dealing spells and creatures. It utilizes low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Ghitu Lavarunner to apply early pressure, while burn spells like Wild Slash and Lightning Strike finish off the opponent. Lurrus of the Dream-Den allows for continuous recursion of creatures or spells from the graveyard. The deck combines aggressive creature play with direct damage spells to create a fast-paced and powerful aggro strategy in the Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on using the combo of Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game by milling your entire library and then winning on the spot with Oracle's ability. The deck includes card draw, counterspells, and removal to help protect the combo and control the game until you can assemble the win condition. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion, providing additional value and consistency to the deck. Overall, the key strategy is to efficiently set up the combo and protect it until you can secure the victory.

The primary focus of this deck is to utilize the Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle combo to win the game. This involves manipulating the library and graveyard to ensure that Thassa's Oracle enters the battlefield after Inverter of Truth has been sacrificed, causing you to win the game instantly. The deck includes cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries to help dig through the deck and control the game. Overall, the deck revolves around setting up the combo efficiently to secure victory.

The deck focuses on using control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while utilizing card advantage and graveyard recursion to outvalue them. It relies on cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Kolaghan's Command to control the board while efficiently generating card advantage with spells like Opt and Discovery / Dispersal. The deck also has access to powerful threats like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy to close out the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on quickly reducing the opponent's life total through low-cost, efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. By using cheap spells like Lightning Strike and Boros Charm, along with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early and often. Eidolon of the Great Revel punishes opponents for playing spells, while Lurrus of the Dream-Den can provide additional value by recasting key creatures from the graveyard. The mana base is optimized for consistent casting of spells and creatures, allowing for a streamlined and aggressive game plan.

The primary focus of the deck is to utilize the combo of Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The deck also includes cards like Dig Through Time, Jace, Wielder of Mysteries, and Narset, Parter of Veils to ensure card advantage and disruption for the opponent. The mana base consists of predominantly blue and black sources to support the combo pieces and control elements. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion providing additional value and flexibility to the deck.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle combo to win the game. By flipping your library upside down with Inverter of Truth and then casting Thassa's Oracle, you can instantly win by having zero cards left in your library. To support this combo, the deck includes cards like Jace, Wielder of Mysteries and Dig Through Time to help you dig through your deck quickly. Cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize provide control and disruption to your opponent while you set up your win condition.

Utilize a 80-card deck with Yorion as your companion to pilot the Dimir Inverter combo strategy. Control the game using disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall, while filtering through your deck with cards like Omen of the Sea and Dig Through Time. Set up your win condition with Jace, Wielder of Mysteries and Thassa's Oracle, eventually using Inverter of Truth to flip your library and win the game. Stay ahead of your opponent with card advantage from Narset, Parter of Veils and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy to secure victory in the late game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Lotus Field card alongside various land tutoring and untapping effects to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This mana is then used to cast powerful spells and combo off with cards like Underworld Breach and Fae of Wishes. The deck aims to efficiently ramp up and assemble its combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a fast and explosive manner.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, utilizing low-cost spells and creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The main strategy is to maintain a high tempo and pressure the opponent with cheap burn spells and hasty creatures, while using Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to provide additional value and resilience. The deck aims to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize or establish a strong board presence, making it a strong choice for players who enjoy quick and explosive matches.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using aggressive creatures and burn spells. With the companion Obosh, the Preypiercer providing additional damage output, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, and Bomat Courier, along with burn spells like Shock and Wild Slash, ensures a fast and consistent source of damage. The deck's key strategy is to maintain consistent pressure and finish the opponent off with powerful attacking creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with a swarm of small creatures, utilizing cards like Thraben Inspector, Knight of the White Orchid, and Daxos, Blessed by the Sun. It also includes powerful enchantments like Elspeth Conquers Death and Stasis Snare for removal and disruption. The deck's main win condition revolves around Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Walking Ballista combo, while also utilizing Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx to generate mana for big plays. Teferi, Time Raveler provides tempo advantage and protection, while the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad offers additional value with blink effects. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure and control the board in a consistent and aggressive manner.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of small, aggressive creatures while using powerful support cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Teferi, Time Raveler to maintain board presence and control. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in a longer game. It aims to establish early dominance and apply pressure, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of aggression and strategic card advantage.
